title: Timberwolves Fans Sound Off on Rudy Gobert Suspension News
desc: Since Rudy Gobert picked up another flagrant foul against the Mavericks, he is set to be suspended by the NBA.

title: Troops arrest Boko Haram drone supplier
desc: Nigerian troops have arrested a 64-year-old Boko Haram supplier, Dauda Gubula, who provided armed drones to insurgents, during a raid in Madagali.

title: Penang's esplanade seawall, promenade project wins Unesco heritage award
desc: GEORGE TOWN: Penang's Esplanade Seawall and Promenade project has been internationally recognised in the 2025 UNESCO Asia-Pacific Awards for Cultural Heritage Conservation, receiving the New Design in Heritage Contexts award with Special Recognition for Sustainable Development.

title: Tracking heavy snow in the Philadelphia; blizzard conditions possible near shore | Live Updates
desc: A Winter Storm Watch will go into effect on Sunday for a system that could bring snow to our area well into Monday.

title: 'I love my man': Mahieka Sharma's romantic reply to Hardik Pandya goes viral

title: UK university owed millions by Malaysian campus, says report
desc: University of Nottingham spokesman says this year's financial statements are 'not reliable' to determine the performance of the campus.

title: David Byrne and Taper Director on the Show Reaching L.A.
desc: David Byrne's musical 'Here Lies Love,' which hit Broadway in 2023, is opening in L.A. He and Mark Taper Forum director Snehai Desai discuss the show.

title: Explainer: What charge might King Charles' brother face after his arrest?
desc: LONDON – King Charles' younger brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office this week, over allegations that he sent confidential British government documents to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.Thames Valley Police, whose detectives questioned the former prince all day on Thursday (Feb 19), have said they are looking into allegations that Mountbatten-Windsor had passed documents to...

title: Cannabis use in adolescence associated with higher rates of psychiatric disorders
desc: Adolescents who use cannabis could face a significantly higher risk of developing serious psychiatric disorders by young adulthood, according to a large new study published today in JAMA Health Forum.
